oai_dc:dc.dc:title: J. G. Decker letter to brother from Camp Wood
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from John G. Decker to his brother Fred commenting on the availability of rations. He also mentions an incident where men from his camp eager to engage the Confederates began singing an anti-secessionist song. Decker also comments on three runaway slaves who arrived in camp. See also the John G. Decker Papers, Mf. 1964.
